prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 2
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: A prosecutor in Germany since age 13, she has come to America to defeat me in court.
Character 3
Name: Max
Description: A "fabulous" magician famed for his aerial illusions. Accused of murder.
Character 4
Name: Regina Berry
Description: The idol of the Berry Big Circus and daughter to Russel Berry, the Ringmaster.
Character 5
Name: Russell Berry
Description: The victim and Ringmaster of the Berry Big Circus. Regina Berry's father.
Character 6
Name: Ben
Description: Real Name: Benjamin Woodman. A ventriloquist. Conversing with him is really tiring.
Character 7
Name: Moe
Description: Real Name: Lawrence Curls. The Ringmaster's old friend, a pleasant stooge of a clown.
Character 8
Name: Acro
Description: Real Name: Ken Dingling. A star acrobat currently undergoing rehabilitation.
Character 9
Name: Bat
Description: Real Name: Sean Dingling. Bit on the head six months ago by Léon. Still in a coma.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: Slightly translucent. It radiates softly with a mysterious light.
Evidence 2
Name: Crime Photo
Description: A picture of the crime scene. A person is lying on a case in the snow. There victim’s footprints leading to where he is are visible.
Evidence 3
Name: Silk Hat
Description: Made-to-order fedora that is a symbol of Max's fabulousness. Found at the crime scene.
Evidence 4
Name: Max G. Promo Poster
Description: Emblazoned with Max's three famous symbols. [info] A silk hat, cloak and white roses.
Evidence 5
Name: Ringmaster's Papers
Description: Documents related to Max's salary negotiations. He got an enormous raise 1 week ago.
Evidence 6
Name: Circus Map
Description: A map of the Berry Big Circus. The circus is depicted on the left. The ring master’s room and cafeteria are on the northeast of the circus. To the right is the lodging house. Moe is on the first floor and Acro is on the third.
Evidence 7
Name: Broken Bottle
Description: An orange juice bottle that was found broken on the cafeteria floor.
Evidence 8
Name: Trilo Quist
Description: A ventriloquist's puppet. An operatic tenor who doubles as Ben's sidekick.
Evidence 9
Name: Money the Monkey
Description: A monkey who takes care of Acro. Habitually gathers all sorts of shiny objects.
Evidence 10
Name: Ring
Description: A cheap ring with an eerie sparkle. "From T to R" is engraved on it. [info] In Phoenix Wright's possession.
Maya:
What's the matter? Did you find something?

Phoenix:
Yeah. Check this out.

Maya:
It's a ring...

Phoenix:
There's something engraved on it... "From T to R"...

Ring put in pocket.
Evidence 11
Name: Russell's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10:15 PM. Cause: Blunt force trauma to the back of the head.
Evidence 12
Name: Wooden Box
Description: The victim was hunched over this 20 lb. box. It was locked by a small key.
Evidence 13
Name: Small Seasoning Bottle
Description: Found inside the Wooden Box the victim was hunched over. It contains pepper.
Evidence 14
Name: Grand Prix Photo
Description: Photo of Max's Award Ceremony. Max is standing at the center holding a trophy. Two girls stand to either side. The bust of max is right next to him.
Evidence 15
Name: Max G. Bust
Description: Bronze statue taken from the cafeteria before the crime. It looks rather heavy.
Evidence 16
Name: Note
Description: Posted in the Cafeteria on the day of the crime, then torn. States: "To The Murderer!" Torn by Ringmaster, found in his tailcoat pocket. Reads To The Murderer! You haven't forgotten what happened six months ago, have you? I have conclusive evidence of what took place. Meet at 10:00 PM tonight at the lodging house plaza. Found in Regina's pocket on the morning of crime. Reads To The Murderer! You haven't forgotten what happened six months ago, have you? I have conclusive evidence of what took place. Meet at 10:00 PM tonight at the lodging house plaza. Placed by Acro in Regina's pocket on morning of crime. Reads To The Murderer!

You haven't forgotten what
happened six months ago,
have you? I have conclusive
evidence of what took place.

Meet at 10:00 PM tonight
at the lodging house plaza.

Evidence 17
Name: Stage Costume
Description: A shiny spangled vest. It's not Maya's size at all.
Evidence 18
Name: Léon
Description: The animal show's lion. Shot by the Ringmaster six months ago for biting a performer.
Evidence 19
Name: Scarf
Description: Bat's scarf. Stained with his blood and a small quantity of pepper.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Don't be so surprised that I was going to propose to Regina!
Person: Trilo
Testimony 1
Testimony: I even had something to give to her...
Person: Trilo
Testimony 2
Testimony: I planned on giving an engagement ring to Regina...
Person: Trilo
Testimony 3
Testimony: I kept it in my pocket, waiting for the chance to propose and give it to her.
Person: Trilo
Testimony 4
Testimony: Of course, I also had it in my pocket that night. It was a present for her.
Person: Trilo
Testimony 5
Testimony: In the end, I wasn't able to give it to her, so I've still got it in my pocket!
Person: Trilo

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user wants just one pair. Let's start by reviewing the testimonies and the evidences provided.

The testimonies from Trilo (Testimony 0 to 5) are all about him planning to propose to Regina with a ring. He says he had the ring in his pocket that night but couldn't give it to her, so he still has it. The key points here are that the ring was in his pocket during the crime and he still has it.

Looking at the evidence, there's Evidence 10: the Ring. It's a cheap ring engraved "From T to R" and is in Phoenix's possession. The "T" could stand for Trilo (since Ben is the ventriloquist and Trilo is his puppet, maybe the puppet's name is used here). The engraving "From T to R" would mean from Trilo to Regina. But according to Trilo's testimony, he still has the ring in his pocket. However, the ring was found as evidence, meaning it's not in Trilo's possession anymore. That's a contradiction. 

Wait, but the ring in evidence is in Phoenix's pocket. How did Phoenix get it? If Trilo claims he still has it, but Phoenix has it, that's a contradiction. So the testimony (Testimony 5) says he still has the ring in his pocket, but Evidence 10 shows the ring was found elsewhere. Therefore, they contradict each other.

cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. The task is to find one pair where the evidence and testimony don't align.

Looking at the testimonies first. All the testimonies are from Trilo Quist, the ventriloquist's puppet. The key points in the testimonies are that Trilo claims to have seen Max (Character 3) at the plaza the night of the murder. Specifically, Testimony 5 says Trilo couldn't mistake Max because he was wearing his three symbols: silk hat, cloak, and white roses. The evidence related to Max's symbols is Evidence 4, the promo poster, which lists those three symbols. But wait, there's also Evidence 0, but that's the attorney's badge. 

Wait, Evidence 3 is the Silk Hat found at the crime scene. So Max's hat was there. But according to the testimonies, Trilo saw someone wearing all three symbols. However, if Max's hat was found at the crime scene, then maybe he wasn't wearing it when Trilo saw him. But Trilo says he saw the three symbols, including the hat. So if the hat was at the crime scene, how could Max be wearing it? Unless someone else was wearing the symbols, but Max's hat was found there. So that would contradict Trilo's testimony that he saw Max with all three symbols, including the hat. Therefore, Evidence 3 (Silk Hat found at the scene) contradicts Testimony 5 (saw the three symbols, implying the hat was on Max). If the hat was found at the scene, Max couldn't have been wearing it when Trilo saw him. So the contradiction is between the presence of the hat at the crime scene and Trilo's claim that he saw Max wearing all three symbols, including the hat. Therefore, the correct pair would be Evidence 3 and Testimony 5.

cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. Let me start by going through the testimonies and evidences one by one.

The testimonies are from Moe. Testimony 0 says he saw a shadow that could only belong to Max. Testimony 1 mentions seeing Max's symbols, like the silk hat and cloak. Testimony 2 specifically lists the silk hat and cloak. Testimony 3 says the face was silhouetted but no doubt it was him. Testimony 4 mentions the cloak fluttering, so couldn't see what he was carrying.

Looking at the evidences, Evidence 3 is Max's silk hat found at the crime scene. Evidence 4 is Max's promo poster with symbols including the silk hat, cloak, and white roses. Then there's Evidence 15, the Max G. Bust, a bronze statue that's heavy. The autopsy report (Evidence 11) says cause of death was blunt force trauma. The wooden box (Evidence 12) was 20 lbs and locked, found with a seasoning bottle (Evidence 13) containing pepper. Also, the scarf (Evidence 19) has pepper stains. 

Wait, the murder weapon might be the bust since it's heavy and could cause blunt force. But Moe's testimonies say he saw Max's symbols (hat and cloak) and the shadow. However, if the bust was taken from the cafeteria before the crime (Evidence 15), maybe the real weapon was the bust. But how does that contradict the testimony?

Testimony 3 says Moe saw Max's face as a silhouette but was sure it was him. But if the bust is a statue of Max's head, maybe the silhouette was actually the bust being carried. Since the bust is heavy, someone else could have used it as the weapon. If the murderer used the bust, which looks like Max, then the shadow Moe saw might have been the bust being moved, not Max himself. So if the testimony claims it was Max, but the evidence (bust) shows that the silhouette could be the statue, that would be a contradiction.

So the contradiction would be between Testimony 3 (Moe being certain it's Max's face) and Evidence 15 (the bust, which resembles Max and could create a similar silhouette). Therefore, Moe might have mistaken the bust for Max's actual face, leading to a contradiction.

cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidence, and testimonies. The task is to identify one pair where the evidence contradicts the testimony.

First, I'll look through the testimonies. Testimony 3 by Moe says, "He was wearing it the entire time that he was on the scene!" The "it" here probably refers to the silk hat mentioned in Testimony 2. Moe is stating that Max was wearing his silk hat the entire time during the incident.

So Evidence 3 (Silk Hat at crime scene) contradicts Testimony 3 (Moe saying he wore it the whole time).
